name: Opal Hall
text:
Very friendly staff. Good food, especially for the location. Pleasant and chill atmosphere, where it doesn’t feel rushed. Good music, lighting and very sweet waitresses. No wait for a table. Late night hours are probably lit 🔥
I brought my 4 year old and everyone was very cool to us, even though it was getting later in the evening.

name: Mira Polion
text: The food was very good and flavorful! I love that they are open so late and they have a drive thru window. I'll definitely be back!

name: Rhonda Hatcher
text: We love this place! The food is amazing and the staff are friendly, pleasant and provide excellent service. Wonderful atmosphere!

name: Janelle Dunn
text: Great food and staff. You won't be disappointed.

name: Thia Chambers
text: The food was well seasoned and tasty. Little pricey for the serving size though. But would definitely return!

name: Dione Hubbard
text: This restaurant is off the chain!  The food was amazing!  The quality customer service was the best I have experienced in Birmingham.  Classy lounge.

name: Tee W
text: Great restaurant,  chill/laid back atmosphere.  The Surf and Turf burger was extremely good!  Mia, our waitresses, provided excellent customer service!  She's the big reason why we'll be coming back.   The owner also came out to greet us.   Definitely recommend!

name: Rasheen Harris
text: I've been coming to this spot for almost 2 weeks and several times even now I've been in here for over 5 hours . Amazing Customer service .. spectacular food you gotta come experience this vibe ...very upscale . I suggest bringing your friends and family here you will be amazed ...11am-2am best vibe in the city

name: Jaquan Readus
text: The staff was very friendly service was great food even better. It's not fast food quick but it's fast for that quality of food. They are new so they are still working out some kinks.

name: E. S.
text: Yesterday, ordered the Fried Grouper(fried to perfection) with Green Beans and their Smack-N-Cheese...🔥🔥🔥... Going back for a Fiesta Bowl....

name: Jacquie Fazekas-Woodcock
text: Amazing food and healthier than most. I love that I can customize my bowl with lots of veggies! Come all Vegans…or folks on a mission to eat healthier. Great dining option or drive-thru.

name: Keyara Collins
text: Never going again food was horrible $20 for a plate of small end ribs with no meat just black inedible black crust around the edges and there was exposed bone on each piece with the ends crusted with what I thought was meat but just burnt inedible crust then on top of that I asked would bbq sauce come with the ribs and I was told yes and once I got my food there was no bbq I spent $34 for food that I could not even eat I do not recommend

name: Michael Gibson
text: Totally not what I expected before I walked through the door. Had the surf and turf burger with the lobster sauce, and cajun ranch fried. It was awesome

name: Kayleigh Hilliard
text: The food was delicious and hot, hostess was very informative about the menu. I love the place. Stop by! They on point! I will return.

name: Madelaine Bowie
text: Love this place! I was first introduced to this restaurant for an event they had, and have been back several times afterwards. I must say they have been consistently 10 out of 10 in customer service, food quality, and overall vibe check.

name: Carrie Minton
text: Everything about this restaurant was great!  Such friendly staff who want you to have a great experience and the food was amazing!!  If you haven’t eaten here you are missing out.

name: Mac Mann
text: The food was amazing and so was the service. A top notch family owned restaurant. I was greeted at the door by TJ and the hospitality didn't end there. My waitress did an amazing job also her name was Darien. I even had the pleasure of meeting the owner Kachief who was not only very knowledgeable about culinary but was also very pleasant to have a conversation with. Very clean environment and the atmosphere was second to none!  I definitely enjoyed myself and look forward to returning to this establishment soon. Thank you to all who I had the privilege of meeting.

name: kethni jyles
text: I love 💝love💝love this place. The food is fresh and the atmosphere is awesome. This is my new party spot.🎉💯

name: Nicholas McCoy
text: This is an amazing place to eat. Great food and excellent customer service. I’ll recommend this place 10/10. I can’t wait to go back.

name: Cottrelle Eatman
text: 2nd time going, love loved both times 1st I had the red snapper fried, green beans and mashed potatoes, it was sooo good. light jazz playing great date place, the 2nd  time I had grouper(love fish) and lamb chops awesome the music was a little loud couldn't hear my conversations across the table,All in all it will be every other weekend dinning. great food.

name: Positive Development
text: Great ambiance, and  fantastic food! Definitely a great vibe. Will definitely plan my next event here!

name: Reginald Davis
text: A new place to eat off of Finley Ave, from a unique menu with a southwestern flavor. I did enjoy the chicken bowl this trip. Check them out.

name: Craig Minton
text: Rasta Pasta, collard greens and smack-N-cheese all delicious. Great service too!

name: Hunter Krug
text: Absolute FIRE! Unique and authentic flavors, plenty of food on the plate, awesome people!! These guys do it right.

name: damon Anderson
text: Amazing place! Food was very great customer service is superbly efficient!

name: Caron Lee
text: Awesome atmosphere, food is dope and the service is soo good. Omg the food, yo be ready to come again, again and again!!!!

name: deedee Dozier
text: 🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰🥰 BEST RESTAURANT IN THE CITY! CAN Y'ALL ADD TURKEY TO THE MENU?

name: Jauwanna Moore
text: We visited this restaurant today and the food and customer service was awesome!

name: GiGi Kinn
text: Burger was juicy and good but fries were awful and the soda was out but didn't realize it till I left

name: aprilk Odom (Ms205eyekandi)
text: Seasoned and cooked very well . Pleasant atmosphere

name: April Devaughn
text: Pleasant vibe.  Entree was excellent.

name: Shameeka Smith
text: Perfect. Food is delicious. I'm going to continue to go

name: Ed Fields
text: Good food, good prices, in a great ambiance.

name: katrina Davis
text: Excellent great customer service

name: Mandrell Mitchell
text: Love it I tell everyone about it

name: Tracy Duncan
text: Absolutely delicious food.

name: Curves Again
text: This place was amazing

name: Ebony T
text: OMG!!! me and family went here for dinner last night. Everything was awesome! My son had a burger, my daughter had the loaded potato, my husband had the lamb chop dinner and I had a chicken salad. The portions are very fulfilling. The only thing I didn't like was the soda. It taste very flat. Not sure if they need a better machine but other than that. I definitely will be back SOON

name: Lissa D
text: The food was delicious, seasoned, and full of flavor. Amazing! Can't wait to go back.

name: Kenneth Richardson
text: 5 star venue & cuisine!!

name: Anthony Roberts
text:
First time eating here was tonight. We had two servers for our party of six and they did fantastic. Drinks never got low and the went above and beyond our needs. My steak was cooked to perfection and the sides tasted fresh.

It is more expensive than your average steakhouse, but worth the money.

name: David Barnett
text:
This was a really good dining experience. The best I've had in a very long time.

Not only was the food excellent but the service was unbelievable. There were three waiters serving us and they were all professional, friendly, and helpful. It's hard for me to understand others who have rated the service as anything less than stellar.

My hat is off to the entire staff at Shula's.

name: Steph M
text:
The combination hostess/bartender/waitress was a great server. She went out of her way for me.
I went for spinach salad, so I can't comment on the steak aspect, but the salad was really good and the drinks were delicious.

name: Stacy Giovinco
text: Steak was average and very expensive and i have had better.  The desert we ordered was out of this world.  The service was great as well.  Great atmosphere.  Only giving it two three stars bc of the desert and service. My bill was $250 for a two average steaks.

resp.text: Hi Stacy - Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback, we very much appreciate hearing what our customers think.  We're so glad you enjoyed our high level of customer service, the atmosphere and your dessert!  But we want to make sure you loved your steak as well!  We would love the opportunity to have you back to "wow" you with our Shula Cut steaks.  If you would like, please email me directly at kt@shula.com and we can communicate further.  Thank you!   - Kristen Thompson

name: Anita Frederick
text: My husband and I come and enjoy date night about once a month at Shula's we love the atmosphere at the bar and enjoy getting to interact with the bartender and patrons. Our best experience has been with Lindsey who went out of her way to make sure we had great service and learned more about the cocktails we were interested in trying as well as taking our food order and delivering great customer service. We love our date night and can't say enough good things about Shula's.

name: Anna Goloforo
text: They  need to change their  dress code.  Just because we didn't come from work, with a suit or pant suit they wouldn't serve  us.   Well they list about 200!ir more dollars for dinner.  That's not too wise

name: Andrew King
text: Failed to cook a rare Ribeye...... twice!! Manager and server had an attitude when we showed them the overcooked steak. The second steak they served us was cold. Also ordered the Filet Trio (medium-rare). Two were medium and one was well-done.... J. Alexanders has better service and they know how to cook a rare steak. Cheers!

resp.text: Hi Mr. King.  Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback on your experience. We use feedback like this to identify issues and address them.  Your feedback has been forwarded to our executive team and to our Shula’s team in Birmingham.  We would like to follow-up with you on your experience.  If you are open to it, please email me directly at kt@shula.com with your phone number. Thank you! - Kristen Thompson

name: David Aarons
text: Service great.  Food way overrated.  Ruths Chris and J Alexander's steaks are much better.  Would not go back.

name: respect my privacy
text:
Felt I was prejudiced against because I’m white, and my GF is Mexican. We went to Shula’s on Valentine’s day. I made reservations 5 days before which gave me the options of 3 time slots. I took the earlier time. When I arrived, (5 minutes late and we called to say so) we had to wait an additional 15-20 to have our table which gave me the impression that they were busy. There was nobody in the PLACE and we had to wait! Olive Garden, Outback does this too: They make you wait and the place is only half full! They purposely make it seem as if they are busy when in fact out of 16 tables in the back room, only 3 were occupied. There were 2 black couples and us.
The black female waitress didn’t have “her game on” as she expressed to the couple behind me. For $150.00 + you better have your S—t together!  We ordered different wines and she never identified to us which wines they were. She just placed them in front of us and proceeded to take our order. She incorrectly took our order by not remembering. Did not write it down either. I ordered the 14 oz. rib eye grilled Pittsburg style, med-rare. She returned to our table telling me that they gave me the next size steak for the same price of the 14 oz. because she did not remember the order. We’ll  guess that was OK. When it came it was not P-Burg style. I asked for sour cream for the mashed potatoes and she did not bring that as well. I noticed the lack of friendliness to me and my GF compared to her report w/ the other American-African couples. She just did not care,
When I commented to her about the experience, I tried to do so in a kindly fashion. She never listened to my advice. Her response was “you don’t have to tip me”. Well I still tipped , but only 10% for the service. So in closing, the prejudice I felt, the sub-par alacrity, overly apologetic waitress I’d rather go to Flemmings Steakhouse instead.

name: Robert Woods
text:
So my wife and I go there for our anniversary. May 17th 2013. We make reservations for 6:45PM. The weather was bad that afternoon and it was Friday so we decide to go a little early. We arrived at 6:20PM. We walked in at the same time that two ladies staying at the Wynfrey did. They got to the maître d's desk a split second before we did. They told the maître d' that they did NOT have reservations but could they eat anyway. They were told yes. I was asked if we had reservations. I told them my name. We were told to have a seat, they would be with us soon. The two ladies got seated immediately. We had to wait almost 25 minutes! When we got our food, my baked potato was not done completely.

Point being, there is apparently no benefit to making reservations!!!!!

name: Charnessa Mz. Watch Me Campbell
text: First time here and the young lady walked us all the way to our table to sit down, once we sat down, she tells me I can't wear my bball cap which is plan gray with no writing at all, so we left and came to J. Alexander's. Thanks for a first time bad experience.

name: Andrew McCarrell
text: I've always had outstanding food and service at Shula's.  I typically go for lunch.

name: Shelia Clary
text: We went this afternoon only to find they were  not opening until 4 pm. The website saus daily 11:30 to 9:30.... the gentleman insode was rude and said well the sign outside says we open at late on Sunday.... I will not ever go back.

name: Koopa Wesson (Koopa)
text: The best steak I've ever eatin.!!!!!! Amazing!!!

name: Ashton Parsons
text: Took two hours for food to arrive, 13 people. It was embarrassing, VIP room, no one else was here.

name: Adam Waldrup
text: Amazing steakhouse!!

resp.text: Thank you for the great rating and kind words! We're glad that you enjoyed your experience at Shula's, and we hope to have you back again sometime soon!

name: Bryan Benson
text: Wonderful,  as usual!

name: m. Rainer
text: Best restaurant in the area!!!  The service here blows every other restaurant in town away.  Food is outstanding and changes with the local produce.  If you want a great meal and you're willing to pay just a little extra for the service this is the place to be.

name: Jimi Threet
text: I've been to Maestro 2300 a twice now. This place is amazing to say the least. The passion in the food is second to none. The ingredients in the food are fresh, complimentary to one another, and always well prepared. The presentation is like art on a plate. The atmosphere in the restaurant is classy yet warm and inviting. The staff are phenomenal, always eager to serve. A great place to take a date or even the family.

name: Jeffrey Chieppa
text: Had drinks and appetizers with the range and reef. Great music, great service, great food. Drinks were good.

name: Ben Boyd
text: Great food, impressive wine menu, excellent service. Perfect for special occasions or when you just want a fine dining experience.

name: Kevin Ellis
text: excellent food and service,  nice atmosphere, clean and relaxing.  Great place to have dinner

name: auburn phan
text:
Would NEVER recommend this place to anyone in Auburn. Me and my boyfriend got food poisoning from eating here. If you are going to spend that much don't spend that much to throw up and stay in the bathroom. Very disappointed.

Food poisoning occurs when you swallow food that contains bacteria, parasites, viruses, or toxins made by these germs.

- Now that is just gross. Clean it up Maestro 2300.

name: Mohammadnaser Ansari
text: You should try the filet burger. Definitely a top 5 burger in Auburn

name: Linda V. Russo
text: Wonderful menu and wine list, and outstanding service !

name: Shaun Johnson
text: Our server Hardy was a godsend! He was knowledgeable about the food and drinks! His recommendations were well appreciated, and delicious!  He even made sure that our toddler had juice, and that her food came out first. The food was amazing,  we had the grouper and bacon wrapped filet. This was our first time, but thanks to our Rockstar server Hardy.... we'll definitely return! Try the chocolate trio for dessert,  you won't regret it!

name: John loper
text:
Sad to see Grille 29 go, happy Grille on Main is here!

Chris gave great service the food was quality if not a bit average and the updates done to the inside were very nice.

I was hoping for a bit more on the Bourbon/Whiskey options, the lump crab flounder was a bit salty for me and the fill was less stuff more soup than I like.

Overall it was a good experience with good food. I am sure as time goes by some tweaks will happen to make it great.

name: Richard Barrett
text: SO I really REALLY wanted to like this place. I loved Grill 29, particularly the brunch and was there most Sunday mornings with friends or family. I have been to Grill on Main twice since it opened (one brunch and on dinner) and could not be more disappointed. The dinner was OK at best, but well below the quality that I would expect. It is some how more expensive than Grill 29, and has substantially lower food quality. Brunch was a utter failure. I went with another family (3 adults and 3 kids in total) an the kids brunch menu is THE KIDS DINNER MENU! Totally no options for kids. Also, I got one of their scramble bowls. Not only was it borderline cold, it had almost no flavor and I had salt and pepper the mess out of it just to make it a decent meal. Not to mention, we arrived as they opened for brunch and it took us over an hour to get our food. The waiters I had both times were amazing, but the kitchen and management is a total failure. I plan to check back in a year (if they are still around by then).

name: Bill Martin
text: My wife and I went to celebrate her birthday, picking Grille on Main over Cotton Row because it's on our side of town and we like to support new, local business.  The food is wonderful!  Our server was very personable and took good care of us.  The decor is much like the former tennant, Grille 29, upscale casual dining. And the menu selection, taste, and prices match.  One aspect of the ambiance that was out of place was the music.  It was mostly 80's hard rock...not obnoxiously loud, just the wrong genre.  Why the low score on service?  They did not accept our Boyce Restaurant Group gift certificate and the manager was unwilling to make any alternate arrangements.  Had we known this,  we would have gone to Cotton Row instead.  To our knowledge, this limitation was not posted, so customer be ware.

name: Sandy Harrison
text: Our family visited Grille on Main on Father’s Day at noon.  Brunch menu was being served. Our orders consisted of eggs Benedict, Cobb salad, ham and cheese omelet, and a standard breakfast of eggs, bacon, and hash browns. In the past 3 weeks, we have enjoyed breakfast/brunch out 4 times - Grille on Main, local self serve bakery, and a meat and 3 cafe.  Unfortunately the Grille on Main was the worst food of the 4 yet the most expensive.  The eggs Benedict were marginal in taste and not hot.  The ham and cheese omelet was almost missing the ham and cheese - very stingy with the ingredients and not much flavor from a normally flavorable cheese.  If you want biscuits, you can get 4 for $5.  They were probably the best part of our meal.  The skillet cinnamon roll was a miss - not hot enough the melt the icing. The Cobb salad was not much bigger than a side salad at most restaurants but it was densely packed and good flavor - just on the small side. Grille 29 that was in this location was superb and we were hoping this would continue the tradition of a great place for ambience, food, romantic dinners, etc.  Unfortunately that was not the case for us. I will say the restaurant recently opened and perhaps they need more time to get things right.  The executive chef is famous and has 2 other superb locations in the area I believe.  Hopefully he can get the quality and quantity to a level commensurate with the prices.

name: Andrianne Adams
text: Absolutely Amazing! My husband and I were here three days in a row. (Actually, he was there three and I was there twice). I've found my new favorite restaurant. The manager, waitresses, and cooks are so welcoming and accommodating. They remembered my husband and I, sat us immediately, and we're very prompt in serving us on each occasion. I will be frequenting this restaurant. I was honestly nervous about going, given my last favorite place was Grille 29, but they exceeded my expectations and I was rid of any doubt upon entry! I can't wait to go back!

resp.text: Thank you for the glowing review. We're here seven days a week and love that y'all came by so much even in our first week!

name: JD S
text: We had all three oyster appetizers and all three were very good. My steak was well seasoned and cooked as ordered. The duck breast had great flavor but one side had to much grill time creating a heavy unappetizing char.. Service was good, place was clean.

name: Keith Jackson
text:
Visited summer 2021, opening week

If you liked Grille 29, you'll like this place too. It's pretty much the same, but mostly different dishes, and maybe a larger menu. The service was great, the food was great, and the atmosphere was wonderful. Everything seemd clean and we'll organized. The staff was friendly and helpful. Would certainly go again.

name: Alan Flynn
text:
Really enjoyed this new opening spot.
Will be returning.  The fried green tomatoes were great. Steak was cooked well and we enjoyed the lobster roll.

resp.text: Thank you! We're very happy you enjoyed everything and look forward to having you back soon.

name: Samantha A
text: Great staff here. We loved the nachos (which are HUGE) and cocktails. Great atmosphere with a nice vibe.

name: George Olden
text: The food was good and the service was excellent. Went for brunch and had a good meal. Plenty of good traditional brunch options that we well executed and good cocktails.

name: Ben Lucke
text: Delicious food, nice atmosphere, and reasonable prices. We tried the filet and the salmon, and would recommend both! The cocktails seemed a bit weak, however.

name: Gary Braden
text:
Fantastic lunch! We already made reservations for Saturday evening!
Thank you so much for all your effort in getting Grille On Main operational!

resp.text: We're so happy you enjoyed your visit. We can't wait to see you next time!

name: Melissa Mudd Zuber
text: Beautiful inside! Great service! Food was so-so. If you are expecting this to be as fabulously delicious as Grille 29 was, you will be greatly disappointed. We had lunch. I had the crispy fish sandwich. It was good, but nothing I would absolutely have to have again. The salad was okay, lettuce, tomato, carrots, onion in a watered-down ranch dressing.  Nothing special. The cole slaw also wasn't interesting. I did like the cooked spinach. It was very good. Don't waste your calories on dessert. The pineapple, upside down, carrot cake was terrible. Carrot cake should always have cream cheese icing. This did not and was very squishy without much flavor. Probably will not go back again. 😕

name: Jason Gilbert
text: Excellent food, service, and atmosphere at a very reasonable price. So excited to have a Chef Boyce restaurant on our side of town.

resp.text: Thank you very much - we're happy to be here in Providence!

name: J B
text: Great atmosphere on the patio, awesome food and drinks. Shout-out to Michael M for the great service.

name: Will Sanders
text: Unfortunately my food just wasn’t good. My steak was nothing special, it honestly tasted like a steak from Logan’s.

name: Ourania Murphy
text: Amazing food, great service, Congratulations Chef Boyce on your 4th restaurant!! I will be back.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your kind words. We'll see you next time!

name: Dani
text:
Bugs in my salad.

Beware, you may get some extra protein in your food.. No telling how many gnats I ingested. They clearly don’t wash their food. I was shocked and never ate at Burke dining hall after this. Burke dining is disgusting. I wouldn’t be surprised if they have rats back there. Some of the workers UA hire need to be fired. They focus too much on football and not enough on their student’s health. What a shame. I wish I could post a picture because I do have a picture of it. Several dead gnats in my salad.

Update: I was able to add a picture.

name: Mary Beth Prondzinski
text: Better than Lakeside!  Lovely cucumber infused water and Moroccan Chick pea soup.  *Note: this was last week's review.  They must have fired the cook because this week's faire was dreadful!

name: Gwendolyn Turner (Ginney)
text: Clean friendly in order enjoyed

name: Brian Umble
text: Daughter bought me lunch...at least she thinks she did. Absolutely loved it.

name: Dalton Kulick
text: It is often that the food is very good but it seems to be quite hit and miss. Half the time, drink machines aren't working, stuff isn't stocked, just simple things that are human errors. It is a good place to go, just expect frustrations at small things that shouldn't be misdone.

name: Mark Smith
text: Best in tha world pray my son get a free ride roll tide

name: Amanda Dykes
text: For a school dining hall, it's really good and the employees are so great.

name: Kismette G
text: Excellent service and staff... and great food!

name: Rodney Lucio
text: Pretty nice for an older dorm.

name: Minnie Hooks
text: Burke Dining Hall was great,enjoyed everything especially visiting my daughter. Dedasha Hooks

name: Rebekah Flowers
text: I like this dining hall the most because it has a good salad bar and is usually less busy I've noticed.

name: John Stabler
text: Nice people and food was good if mediocre.

name: Ron Swanson
text: Meat is passable. Has a horrendous teeny bopper music soundtrack playing during all hours of operation. I commend the staff for working through this no matter how demoralizing that sonic garbage is. I would prefer to have my breakfast in silence.

name: Kevin sellers
text: Great salad bar, and many choices buffet style.

name: Zach Weske
text: Some of the best dining hall food on campus

name: Steve Wonder
text: Food ok most workers looked as if they would rather be anywhere then there. No active supervision seen

name: Helena Johnson
text: Food was good and fresh

name: Tonmoy Ghosh
text: healthy food. large number of food collection.

name: David Tidwell
text: Food was a little dry

name: Priscilla Vincent
text: Loved it.

name: Maytreecia Harriell
text: Nice facility...

name: Hunter Standridge
text: Burke is my favorite of the dining halls.

name: Jackson Stellhorn
text: 2nd and 26

name: Wanza Wilson
text: Great employees

name: Rickey Giddeon
text: It's ok

name: Kyle Nadler
text: at least it's not lakeside

name: rl caj (rl)
text:
WRONG HOURS ON HERE!!

Burke
Saturday     11:30 AM - 7:30 PM
Sunday       11:30 AM - 7:30 PM
Monday       7:00 AM - 8:30 PM
Tuesday      7:00 AM - 8:30 PM
Wednesday 7:00 AM - 8:30 PM
Thursday     7:00 AM - 8:30 PM
Friday          7:00 AM - 8:30 PM

name: Nicolás Martorell
text:
(Translated by Google) I could have more variety

(Original)
Podria tener mas variedad

name: Kenny Young
text:
When I arrived in town, I was looking for good chicken wings. Boy - did I find them!! The wings (mild/sweet - sauce made in-house) were great!! I had the Combo Tray that included strips, as well. They were delicious! Moist, well-seasoned and terrific made in-house ranch and house dipping sauces.  Now...I wish I lived closer to eat here often.
Thank you Jay and Darlene for making me welcome!!

name: Wiley S. (Eye Say)
text: Jay's is a great spot for lunch and to watch the game. They have an all-you-can-eat salad bar that's a winner for lunch. For the games, the wings and blue crab claws are a favorite. Laid back atmosphere with attentive service. It's a good place to hang out with friends are to grab some take out.

name: Thomas Hughes
text: Took my beautiful wife there,we had a hamburger steak with onions and gravy,fries,it cost me a little money but my wife is worth every penny and more,i would have spent a hundred dollars on her,because i love my babygirl and i miss you so much baby.

name: Erin
text: Its been about 4 years since i have eaten here and they did not disappoint! My husband says this is his new favorite wing spot. Its a small drive outside of the town we live in but worth every mile

name: Rickey Moore
text: Service was good. The food was okay. It appeared the burger and fries may have seen a microwave.....

name: Majyst Thalsbane
text: The atmosphere is relaxed. The food is great for the price. The salad bar is adequate but lacking some choices and has poor flow. The building has had some work going on for quite a while. Aparantly there used to be a big aquarium in there but now it is adorned with blue tarps. Overall it is a nice quiet place to eat and talk with colleagues.

name: Stacey Thrasher
text: They have a great burger and their fish is very good too. The prices are very competitive. The only problem we had was my mom ordered the chicken livers and they were cooked far too long and very hard and dry. When my mom said something they cooked her up another huge plate and didn't cook them as long, she said they were good. The waitresses are super nice and wait time on getting your order is about average. I would definitely recommend a visit if you are in the area.

name: anthony latino
text: Great spot for some good fresh food. Service was exceptional. Jodie was great took care of all our needs with a smile and professionalism. Fresh salad bar. Comfortable atmosphere fair prices thanks I'll be back soon

name: Alan Simmons
text:
Best burgers and lemon pepper chicken fingers anywhere!
They're also great supporters of Sylacauga Fire/EMS and the LifeSaver helicopter crews!

name: Barry Grace
text: Staff were good but food was pretty blah.

name: Tara Ackles
text:
I ordered a kids finger snack an was over charged for the meal. I've always paid 7.00. So today the meal was 8.09. I called and asked how much was a kids finger meal. I was told 5 and some change. My reply was, well why was I charged 8.09 for the meal?  Then I was asked " did you order toast"
Me " yes sir, but I was told that the toast came with the meal and we have to ask for it if we want it"
He hangs up an my Point is if the bread was free. Why was I charged extra !!!!
You gotta do better. It wouldn't have taken but a second to explain what happened. And you're supposed to treat people the way you want to be treated.. if over charging me is gonna help or bless your Business so be it.

name: Brian Mathews
text: Understaffed on a Friday night and restaurant is less than half capacity.  Food was good...

name: Mary Crist
text: Hubby said his burger was good. I had chicken alfredo which lacked flavor!!! Side salad was lettuce, tomatoes and a sprinkle of cheese. Atmosphere pretty blah. Then they have a 3.75% fee to use debit or credit card!!

name: Vickie Barnett
text: Food was great. Chris is the best server ever!

name: ToastyDoasty
text: I like how Relaxing it is The Food is great too place is sanitary and Staff are nice greatest time I've had here!

name: Amy Maddox
text: I order on a weekly basis to have my meal delivered to work on my busiest days. It is always right, prompt and delivered by a friendly courteous young man. I am thankful for a place like you guys! I love the healthy choices and no one has better grilled chicken tenders!

name: Colleen Papajohn
text: OMG, IT WAS PHENOMENAL WILL DEFINITELY BE GOING BACK!!

name: Matthew McClellan
text: Really good food! Tons of TVs to catch the games. Fast, friendly service with a smile.

name: Tammy Oliver
text: Best philly cheesesteak hands down

name: Scott Campbell
text: Just bad! Nothing like it was years ago.  Hold on to that money you got from me tonight, because I’ll never spend another dime there.

name: Gregory and Patricia Bailey
text: Have good chicken wings.

name: Martez Tidwell
text:
Ordered via delivery and it took 2 hours for them to make it to my place. I live less than 10 minutes away. Food was average and soggy upon delivery.

Done with Jays for good!

name: Rudy Menchaca
text:
The best bacon cheeseburger I've had in a very long time.  Burger was juicy and cooked to perfection!

From order to receiving my lunch it took 10 min!!!

Definitely coming back.

name: Lucille Anderson
text: I'm not a big fan of burgers but I had a burger there that was absolutely wonderful my first time visiting this restaurant went with a friend

name: RydFree
text: Jay's has been consistently good for many years. The wings are great and love the flame grilled  hamburger steak and gravy . The wait staff has always been top notch when we visit. It's also nice to take advantage of the delivery service on game day .

name: Nathan Kelley
text: Not sure how it's still open. We decided to give it another shot after being disappointed last year. The burger tasted good but when your menu says chips and queso, serve queso. We got Alfredo sauce in a bowl. We questioned the waitress and she admitted it was Alfredo. Looks like a cost saving measure, I wonder what other ways they are trying to cut cost?

name: Aaron Johnson
text: Atmosphere could use a make over.  When I think sports bsr/grill I expect to see a bar as the showcase inside the restaurant. Apparently they only had Michelob Ultra and Bud Light on tap tonight,  two beers I don't drink.  The atmosphere is pretty bland.  If this is meant to be a sports bar/grill then the TVs and bar need to be the prominent feature when you walk in.  That is not the case here at all.

name: amanda east
text: First my husband was given unsweetened tea when he asked for sweet and the food  was not that great. The philly cheese steak was terrible. The service was not great either.

name: Katie Sims
text: The owner of this restaurant is one of the kindest people I have ever met! His bbq is amazing as well!

name: Shan Nicholson
text: Service GREAT. Atmosphere GREAT.  Food cool

name: Amber (Momma4life)
text: Food serving was small for the price and if I pay that much for mix drinks I want to feel it and it tasted like it had no alcohol in it there and service wasn't the best

name: Shonnie Mcneill
text: We enjoy the food whether it is dine in or delivery. The delivery service is great. Always fast and accurate.

name: stacey ellison
text: TERRIBLE!!!!! Waitress cursed in front of my son. Poor waitress service. After sending first plate back because of the hot dipping sauce being too salty/sour, my 2nd finger plate with mild sauce had warm tenders, obviously "kept on stand-by." Then the waitress wanted to argue with me that she saw him pull them out of the fryer. They ended up taking the charge for my plate off but instead of the 4.99 for the salad bar she charged me the full price of 8.99 although my husband and son also had meals. We had two waters and my son had tea which was supposed to come with the meal but was charged 2.79 for all three drinks. I have never been so dissatisfied! We WILL NOT BE BACK!

name: Wendy Nelson
text: They have a great salad bar! I've only ate there twice got steak both times, very good food! Staff is friendly!

name: Sir Flea Brownlow
text: Great mild sauce!!! Loved it.  Will be back.

name: Kathy Matthews
text: Always great food and service!

name: Kandria Johnson
text: The service was nice. The waitress was familiar with the menu. Make sure you call in your order ahead of time if you don't want a long wait. The food was hot and fresh.

name: Payton Barnett
text: Usually I love Jr's for their service. Tonight it has taken them an hour to deliver my food and the fries are soggy. Would like if this could improve.

name: Sam Allen
text: The JR'S crew is awesome. Food is delivered fresh and on time. Looking forward to many more excellent experiences at this fine resturant. And a side note the delivery service is amazing. I have never had an order take any longer than 20 mins to make it to my house.

name: Jacob Lee
text: Great food.  The owner is a great guy as well

name: Susan Compton
text: Great wings & atmosphere! We love the ranch & hen house salad, too!

name: Ken Pate
text: Wings are great. Hamburger Steak is really good too.

name: Elizabeth Cochran
text: Quick deliveries & fair prices for good food

name: Misty Butler
text: Good food and great service

name: Jonathan Williams
text: Used to eat just wings here, been branching out a little and it's been good. Love this place. Eat here 2 or 3 times a week.

name: joseph parrish
text: The catfish meal was okay but a little pricey

name: K Truett
text: Never had bad food here. Love it!

name: Kris Haberstroh
text: The food is pretty decent but the atmosphere is bland and depressing. Not much going for it and my waitress was very kind and sweet but manager or store owner (whatever) was VERY unprofessional. My friend and I over heard the man make inappropriate jokes and comments to his employees in front of everyone else in the restaurant. It honestly made me uncomfortable. If I ever come back to JRs, I'm getting my food Togo.

name: Michael King
text: Just passing through, so we thought we would try it out. Never again. Wings were fried and had no meat hardly at all. Also the price is a rip off. Very dissatisfied customer trying not to eat at just a chain restaurant on 280.

name: Tyra Fallon
text: I take my mom to lunch at J.R's everytime I am in town for a visit. Their salad bar is great and has several options other than veggies. It also has pasta salad, chicken salad, sunflower seeds, cottage cheese, bacon, ham, egg etc. The catfish is AMAZING and the staff is friendly. It's a great place all in all in my many experiences.

name: Illya Nation
text: Friendly service, Great Food, almost as if you were visiting Family!

name: Doug Merkel
text: Service was slow food was good.

name: Sally Morris
text: Food is Great and so is the service

name: Glenn Hebson
text: Best chicken fingers around!

name: pinkey patel
text: Great food good service and nice dine in renovation 👍🏼

name: Francheskia Meadows
text: I called to make and order and during my order they hung up on me. I tried to call to back to see what happened no answer.... I think its very unprofessional and they will no longer get any Kore business from.....

name: Michael Bullock
text: Great food and service

name: Cary Markham
text: Nice, clean dinning with TV's for sporting events and such, Good atmosphere.

name: Tadpole Mc
text: The service was great and the food was also great!

name: Cary Markham
text: Nice, clean dinning with TV's for sporting events and such, Good atmosphere.

name: Stephanie Bellamy
text: I always come to JRs and get the same thing.  But today I want to try something new so I ordered the fried catfish dinner and it was very disgusting my fish with not seasoned and it was not fried all the way the hush puppies taste nasty the mac & cheese was kraft From the box.  They did not care about making their customers happy today.  Not happy with their service.

name: Mark White
text: Good place to eat good people

name: Myrna Kervin
text: Good food for a decent price

name: Tracy Culp McClellan
text: Excellent service, fantastic food...

name: Jonja Collier
text: Great Hen House Salad!

name: Robert Crist
text: Burger was good.but to charge 3.75 percent to use a  credit or debit card is ridiculous.....

name: Randy Giles
text: It was very good we will be back again

name: Alan Holmes
text: Food is grease service is slow they act confused really not enjoyable

name: John Daniel
text: Good wings!!!

name: terrell white
text: This place is awesome always a pleasure to come

name: Joe Gamel
text: Slow service to start, but did get a lot better thru the visit

name: Amber Johns
text: Great food and wonderful people!!

name: Mrs. Gooden36
text: The food was ok and services

name: Emily Harris
text: I have went there twice and was very displeased with the food the taste was gross but the wait staff was great.

name: Kimberly Varner
text: love wing basket dipped in mild

name: Access Equipment Corp
text: Try the fried cheese chunks

name: Carrie Whitten
text: The staff was horrible the food was nasty and it just seemed gloomy

name: Liz Acklin
text: Love the hotwings.

name: Donald Ray
text: Lots of 32 inch TVs. Larger ones are needed for the size of the place & the distance from most of the tables. My burger was unimpressive.

name: Geri Yaz
text: Great

name: Austin Allred
text: Great food

name: Nadia Champion
text: Food was dripping in grease

name: Fred Sherrill
text: Exceptional

name: Hayley Elana
text: Great

name: Sherry Campbell
text: Love the wings

name: Judy Skates
text: Very nice

name: Eddie Daniel
text: Great!

name: Michelle Meyer
text: Prices are ok

name: John Dyer
text: Enjoy the food and the staff

name: Zharia Jackson
text: Great service

name: Stacey Cryer
text: Friendly Staff

name: Tymesha Bennett
text: Bullshit ass service and cold food.

name: william carlton
text: Great!
